authors.name: Andrea R Daniel
authors.note: This protocol was adapted form Sean McCutcheon's work in the Gersbach lab at Duke University.

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4164g","text":"This protocol describes methods for performing ATACseq on human HER2 targeted CAR T cells overexpressing BATF3 or GFP. Chromatin remodeling was assessed in acutely and chronically stimulated cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: ATACseq, T cells, CAR T cells, BATF3, HER2 CAR T cells, SKBR3
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"ep5na","text":"McCutcheon, S.R., Swartz, A.M., Brown, M.C. et al. Transcriptional and epigenetic regulators of human CD8+ T cell function identified through orthogonal CRISPR screens.Nat Genet (2023). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-023-01554-0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":44,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":168,"length":9},{"style":"sup","offset":105,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qgd7","text":"

trimmer for Illumina sequence data. Bioinformatics 30,
2114–2120 (2014).

75. Corces, M. R. et al. An improved ATAC-seq protocol reduces
background and enables interrogation of frozen tissues. Nat.
Methods 14, 959–962 (2017).

and memory-efficient alignment of short DNA sequences to the
human genome. Genome Biol. 10, R25 (2009).

(2017).

data. Nucleic Acids Res. 42, W187–W191 (2014).

80. Zhang, Y. et al. Model-based analysis of ChIP–seq (MACS).
Genome Biol. 9, R137 (2008).

81. Yu, G., Wang, L.-G. & He, Q.-Y. ChIPseeker—an R:Bioconductor
package for ChIP peak annotation, comparison and visualization.

		","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93qmr","text":"
	","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"65mo5","text":"Plate 1.2 x 106 or 7 x 106 HEK293T cells in a 6 well plate or 10 cm dish in the afternoon with 2 mL or 12 mL of complete opti-MEM (Opti-MEM‱ I Reduced Serum Medium supplemented with 1x  Glutamax, 5% FBS, 1 mM Sodium Pyruvate, and 1x MEM Non-Essential Amino Acids).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cpsfc","text":"The next morning, transfect HEK293T cells with 0.5 μg pMD2.G, 1.5 μg psPAX2, and 0.5 μg transgene for 6 well plates or 3.25 μg pMD2.G, 9.75 μg psPAX2, and 4.3 μg transgene for 10 cm dishes using Lipofectamine 3000.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1iuv","text":"Exchanged media 6 hours after transfection and collect and pool lentiviral supernatant at 24 hours and 48 hours after transfection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5jprf","text":"Isolated CD8+ T cells from individual donors were obtianed directly from vials purchased from StemCell Technologies. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"68fgr","text":"Culture T cells in PRIME-XV T cell Expansion XSFM (FujiFilm) supplemented with 5% human platelet lysate (Compass Biomed), 100 U/ml penicillin and 100 μg/ml streptomycin. All media were supplemented with 100 U/ml human IL-2 (Peprotech). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transduction of primary human CD8+ T cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9iin0","text":"Centrifuged lentiviral supernatant at 600g for 10 min to remove cellular debris. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transduction of primary human CD8+ T cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9a54","text":"Concentrate lentivirus to 50–100× the initial concentration using Lenti-X Concentrator (Takara Bio). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transduction of primary human CD8+ T cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"84nob","text":"Transduce T cells at 5–10% v/v of concentrated lentivirus at 24 h post-activation. For dual transduction experiments, T cells were serially transduced at 24 h and 48 h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: T cell stimulation with HER2+ tumor cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6g7r9","text":"HER2+ SKBR3 breast cancer cells were maintained in Dulbecco's modified Eagle medium (DMEM) GlutaMAX supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS), 1mM sodium pyruvate, 1x MEM nonessential amino acids, 10mM HEPES, 100U/ml penicillin and 100ug/ml streptomycin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: T cell stimulation with HER2+ tumor cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6tj6b","text":"Transfer 1 x 105 HER2 CAR T cells (with or without BATF3 overexpression) to a new 24-well plate with 2 x105 SKBR3 cells (1:2 E:T ratio) every 3 days (T cells are stimulated on days 3, 6, and 9).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":15,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":106,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: T cell stimulation with HER2+ tumor cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a2uq","text":"T cells are removed from antigen stimulation for 2 days to recover after the final round of tumor cell stimulation before ATAC-seq on day 14 after transduction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fokgf","text":"Sort a total of 5 × 104 transduced CD8+ T cells for Omni ATAC-seq as previously described75. See the published Omni ATAC-seq reference protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":22,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":38,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":89,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":89,"length":2}],"data":{}},{"key":"cd4cb","text":"https://doi.org/10.1038/protex.2017.096","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5nvtb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A815BE328F9311EE94090A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR75"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c31t8","text":"Libraries were sequenced on an Illumina NextSeq 2000 with paired-end 50-bp reads. Read quality was assessed with FastQC and adapters were trimmed with Trimmomatic72.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":162,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":162,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0A55D24B8F9411EE94090A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR72"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ami79","text":"Trimmed reads were aligned to the Hg38 reference genome using Bowtie76(v1.0.0) using parameters -v 2–best–strata -m 1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":68,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":68,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"20D4EEBF8F9411EE94090A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR76"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bt1vu","text":"Reads mapping to the ENCODE hg38 blacklisted regions were removed using bedtools2 (ref. 77) intersect (v2.25.0). Duplicate reads were excluded using Picard MarkDuplicates (v1.130 (ref. 78)). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":88,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":185,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":88,"length":2},{"key":1,"offset":185,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"26AECFDB8F9411EE94090A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR77"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"26AECFDB8F9411EE94090A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR78"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kbg3","text":"Count-per-million-normalized bigWig files were generated for visualization using deeptools bamCoverage79 (v3.0.1).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":102,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":102,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"31BB3BDC8F9411EE94090A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR79"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fbmsm","text":"Peak calling was performed using MACS2 narrowPeak80 and filtered for Padj ≤ 0.001. Peak calls were merged across samples to make a union-peak set.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":49,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":69,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":70,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3F49E0C18F9411EE94090A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR80"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"tado","text":"A count matrix containing the number of reads in peaks for each sample was generated using featureCounts73 (subread v1.4.6) and used for differential analysis in DESeq2 (ref. 68) (v.1.36). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":104,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":175,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":104,"length":2},{"key":1,"offset":175,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"47E536BF8F9411EE94090A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR73"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"47E536BF8F9411EE94090A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR68"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cag7h","text":"ChIPSeeker81 was used to annotate the genomic regions and retrieve the nearest gene around each peak.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":10,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":10,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"501427D08F9411EE94090A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR81"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c8ful","text":"HOMER (v4.11) package82 was used to find transcription factor binding motifs that contributed to changes in chromatin accessibility with BATF3 OE compared to control cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":21,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5DF335FC8F9411EE94090A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR82"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bkaj9","text":"We defined the set of target differentially accessible peaks using DESeq2 (Padj \u003c 0.05) and a background set of nondynamic regions (p value \u003e 0.2 and |log2(fold change)| \u003c 0.2) with all sets having a sufficiently large number of sequences. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4s1mu","text":"Next, for each set we extracted FASTA sequences from the human reference genome (GRCh38) and ran findMotif.pl to discover motifs and compute the enrichment over background. By default, this function uses a hypergeometric distribution to score motifs to calculate enrichment p-values, controlling for differences in GC-content across target and background sets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: ATAC-seq, primary human T cells overexpressing BATF3
